tags.name: step
tags.description: An optional object that describe the step (see #stepDefaults)

tags.name: force
tags.description: If force is set to `true` the tour will be forced to start
Promise that will be resolved when the step is shown
The deferred will be resolved when the step `index` will be shown

tags.name: event
tags.description: A string containing one Bootstrap-tour event types, it can be "hide", "hidden", "show", "shown" or "skip". Each event can have a `:step{index}` path appended. For instance the event "shown:step0" will be triggered when the first step will be shown on screen.

tags.name: selector
tags.description: A selector string to filter the descendants of the selected elements that trigger the event.

tags.name: data
tags.description: Data to be passed to the handler in event.data when an event is triggered.

tags.name: handler
tags.description: A function to execute when the event is triggered.

description.full: Attach an event handler function for one event.
description.summary: Attach an event handler function for one event.

code: Tour.prototype.on = function(event, selector, data, handler) {};

tags.name: name
tags.description: A string containing one Bootstrap-tour event types, such as "hide", "hidden", "show", "shown" or "skip".

tags.name: data
tags.description: Data to be passed to the handler in `event.data` when an event is triggered.

tags.name: handler
tags.description: A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.

description.full: Attach a handler to an event. The handler is executed at most once.
description.summary: Attach a handler to an event. The handler is executed at most once.

code: Tour.prototype.one = function(event, data, handler) {};

tags.name: handler
tags.description: A handler function previously attached for the event(s), or the special value false.

code: Tour.prototype.off = function(event, handler) {};

tags.description: The promise will be resolved when the next step will be shown

description.full: Hide current step and show next step
description.summary: Hide current step and show next step

tags.description: The promise will be resolved when the previous step will be shown

description.full: Hide current step and show previous step
description.summary: Hide current step and show previous step

tags.description: The promise will be resolved when the tour ended
true if the tour is ended
The promise will be resolved when the first step will be shown

tags.name: activated
tags.description: If true, all `Tour` emitted events will be displayed in console

tags.name: def
tags.description: the deferred will be resolved when the step is shown

tags.name: def
tags.description: the deferred will be resolved when the step is shown

tags.name: def
tags.description: A deferred that will be resolved when the popover will be shown or reject if the step was not found

tags.string: The augmented jQuery Event object contains:
Note that `onShow` Event does not provides the `element` attribute use `onShown` instead)

description.full: Prevent popups from crossing over the edge of the window
description.summary: Prevent popups from crossing over the edge of the window

description.full: Scroll to the popup if it is not in the viewport
description.summary: Scroll to the popup if it is not in the viewport

tags.name: timeout
tags.description: How much time to wait after the last `resize` event before firing fn

tags.string: Handle escape key -> end the tour

tags.name: arr
tags.description: an array of function that return a promise

description.full:
Get the a non falsy property prop from obj1 if present or from obj2 otherwise and transfer
arguments args if the property is a function
description.summary:

arguments args if the property is a function

description.full: Get the value of val, it handles the case when val is a function
description.summary: Get the value of val, it handles the case when val is a function

tags.description: Chainable function that returns the current Tour instance

code: Tour.defaults = {

tags.string: This option is used to build the name of the cookie where the tour state is stored. You can initialize several tours with different names in the same page and application.

code: name: "tour",
persistence: "Memory",
keyboard: true,

tags.description: css code that will be injected if `overlay` is used

description.full: Specify a function that return a css string
description.summary: Specify a function that return a css string

description.full:
Global step parameters

Each of the following parameters can be overriden at each step level.
description.body: Each of the following parameters can be overriden at each step level.

code: step: {
title: null,
content: null,

tags.string: Note: if `addClass` is defined at the step level.
The two defined `addClass` will be taken into account in the popover

description.full: Css class to add to the .popover element
description.summary: Css class to add to the .popover element

code: addClass: "",

tags.string: Handle Bootstrap modal, pull requests are welcome !

description.full: Globally enable an overlay for each step element, true if activated, false otherwise
description.summary: Globally enable an overlay for each step element, true if activated, false otherwise

code: overlay: false,

description.full: Globally enable the reflex mode, click on the element to continue the tour
description.summary: Globally enable the reflex mode, click on the element to continue the tour

code: reflex: false,

tags.string: will be removed at runtime by Bootstrap Tour if necessary.
The template function can be an underscore template or $.tmpl ...

tags.description: A string containing the HTML that will be injected into the popover

code: Tour.stepDefaults = {

description.full:
Path to the page on which the step should be shown. this allows you
to build tours that span several pages!
description.summary:
Path to the page on which the step should be shown. this allows you
to build tours that span several pages!

code: path: "",

description.full: HTML element on which the step popover should be shown.
description.summary: HTML element on which the step popover should be shown.

code: element: null,

description.full: How to position the popover - top | bottom | left | right.
description.summary: How to position the popover - top | bottom | left | right.

code: placement: "right",
title: "",

tags.string: Note: defining `step.title` and `step.content` functions at the tour level
allow the developper to separate step title/content from the step behaviour.

code: content: "",

description.full: Apply a css fade transition to the tooltip.
description.summary: Apply a css fade transition to the tooltip.

code: animation: true,

description.full: Enable the reflex mode, click on the element to continue the tour
description.summary: Enable the reflex mode, click on the element to continue the tour

code: reflex: false,

description.full: Css class to add to the .popover element for this step only
description.summary: Css class to add to the .popover element for this step only

code: addClass: ""
